name: IN RE Otis B. BRASCOM, Petitioner

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties: IN RE Otis B. BRASCOM, Petitioner
attorneys: Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied, and petition for a writ of mandamus and/or prohibition dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court's process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petition in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals , 506 U.S. 1, 113 S.Ct. 397, 121 L.Ed.2d 305 (1992) (per curiam ).
casebody.head_matter:
IN RE Otis B. BRASCOM, Petitioner
No. 19-5288
Supreme Court of the United States.
October 7, 2019
Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied, and petition for a writ of mandamus and/or prohibition dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court's process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petition in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals , 506 U.S. 1, 113 S.Ct. 397, 121 L.Ed.2d 305 (1992) (per curiam ).
